Peter Warlow, The Reversing Earth, 1982, p.177

"It's surprising how many people expect others to listen to their own ideas, yet do not wish to hear the ideas of others. This is especially true when the person considers himself to have some expertise, and finds his ideas being challenged by an 'outsider'. Yet it is the 'expert' who is often in the position of being unable to see the wood for the trees."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Expertise Interferes With Listening
